Package autumn.lang

Interface Record

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Record>, Iterable
All Known Subinterfaces:
RecordAnalyzer.Citizen, RecordAnalyzer.Person
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractRecord
public interface Record extends Iterable, Comparable<Record>
An instance of this interface is a user-defined key-value mapping data-structure.

This interface only defines the minimum required functionality. Convenience functions are provided by class autumn.util.Records and class autumn.util.F.

Subtypes of this interface should provide covariant overrides of the set(String, Object) method. For example, a type name T should provide a set(String, Object) : T method.

Author:
Mackenzie High

    • values

      List<Object> values()
      This method creates a new list containing the value of each element in this record.

      This is a linear-time operation.

      The new collection is not backed by this object.

      Returns:
      the aforedescribed immutable list.

    • set

      Record set(int index, Object value)
      This method assigns a new value to a specific element.

      Auto-unboxing will be performed, if necessary. However, the unboxed value will not be automatically widened.

      Parameters:
      index - is the index of the element to assign the value to.
      value - is the new value.
      Returns:
      this object, if this record is mutable; otherwise, return a modified copy thereof.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out-of-bounds.
      ClassCastException - if the object is not of an acceptable type.

    • compareTo

      int compareTo(Record other)
      This method compares this record to another given record.

      Records are compared based on the natural ordering of their values(). If the other object is null, then this object is object is greater. If the other object is non-null, then the two records must have exactly the same keys().

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Record>
      Parameters:
      other - is the other record itself.
      Returns:
      an integer indicating the relationship of this record to the other record.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the comparison operation could not be completed.

    • equals

      boolean equals(Object other)
      This method determines whether this record equals another object.

      Equality Rules:

      1. If other is null, then return false.
      2. If this is the same object as other, then return true.
      3. If other is not a Record, return false.
      4. If this.keys() is not equal to other.keys(), then return false.
      5. If this.values() is not equal to other.values(), then return false.
      6. Return true.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - is a value that may be equal to this object.
      Returns:
      true, iff this record equals the given value.

    • hashCode
